usefulItems: silicone bread mat, plastic wrap, 2 x 12-hole muffin trays, bowl, baking paper, rolling pin, round cookie cutter (7 cm), refrigerator, oven
title: Buckwheat mushroom tartlets

ingredients.content: 100 g salted butter, cut into pieces
gluten free flour mix, for dusting (see Tips)
40 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into pieces (3 cm)
1 brown onion, cut into quarters (approx. 130 g)
1 sprig fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
10 sprigs fresh chives, finely sliced, for garnishing

preparations.content: Place buckwheat into mixing bowl and mill <b>1 min/speed 9<b>.
Add salt and butter and mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add water and egg yolk and knead <b>30 sec/<b>. Transfer dough onto a floured silicone bread mat or work surface and shape into a ball. Form pastry into a flat disc and wrap in plastic wrap, then place into refrigerator to chill for 30 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Set aside 2 x 12-hole muffin trays.
Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place mushrooms into mixing bowl and chop <b>1 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a separate bowl and set aside.
Place onion and parsley into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>.  Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and oil and cook <b>5 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add reserved mushrooms and cook <b>5 min/Varoma//speed 1<b>.
Add milk and cook <b>3 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Set aside in mixing bowl to cool for 5 minutes.
Add egg, cream, salt, pepper and nutmeg and combine <b>5 sec//speed 2<b>. Set aside in mixing bowl.

Remove pastry from refrigerator and roll out thinly between 2 sheets of baking paper (3 mm thickness). Using a round cookie cutter (7 cm), cut out pastry rounds and use rounds to line muffin trays. Re-roll remaining pastry (3 mm thickness) and cut out pastry rounds (7 cm) to line remaining muffin trays (24 pastry rounds in total).
Fill pastry cases with mushroom mixture (approx. 1 tablespoon), then sprinkle with reserved grated Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 15 minutes (200°C), or until puffed and set. Allow to cool in tray before removing (approx. 15 minutes), then garnish with chives and serve warm.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to the Gluten free flour mix recipe on this recipe chip.
